tags: sexism does play a role in these hate videos
whether you like captain marvel or not you have to admit that this ideology isn't okay to expose kids to
summary:
The problem with Brie Larson hate videos on Youtube
No matter what you do. If you're a Marvel fan you'll get recommended these...
body:
The problem with Brie Larson hate videos on Youtube

No matter what you do. If you’re a Marvel fan you’ll get recommended these hate videos. Know what my problem with these videos is? Well besides the hate. It’s the fact that there are fans that are kids who will get recommended these videos too. Kids younger than 10 are getting phones and now have access to more than just basic knowledge but exposure to right wing content and hateful videos.

Why do I bring this up? Because I have a 12 yr old nephew who watched these videos and fed into the content of hating Captain Marvel and hating feminism. And I found him joking to his baby sister saying, “You belong in the kitchen, that’s what your gender is for.” Because the comments and the anti-feminism message of these videos were absorbed by him. I had to have a serious talk with him about how it wasn’t okay.

It bothers me that there are probably young girls watching these videos and feeling bad about themselves. There are literal sexist comments about women in these hate videos and it sucks thinking that as an adult i just wanna enjoy Captain Marvel videos, imagine what a young kid or teen must be feeling being exposed to this. Being exposed even more early to sexism and as a young person, could possibly effect their views and morals.

Thus only furthering gender inequality ideology.

Not just that. But for male kids and teens. They might have originally liked Captain Marvel but then watch these videos and are turned against liking Captain Marvel and get sexist feelings after watching it. Like my nephew.

I feel bad for the young kids and teens who like Captain Marvel and will have to stumble across this right-wing hateful content. I firmly believe Youtube needs to get rid of videos like this because I hate seeing my nephew act sexist at a young age. Kids absorb content, they pay attention.

I’m not trying to sound like a “Oh but the children!” Kind of person. But literally this type of content can effect how people think. Especially in kids. I had an adult male friend of mine who enjoyed Captain Marvel then got turned against her in seconds after watching those videos. I worry for what anyone younger would think. You don’t even have to be a fan or like Captain Marvel, just be worried that some kids are being taught sexism quite easily through YouTube. As adults we need to make sure we teach kids to respect each other and not discriminate against gender.

I hope that this hate eventually dies off because kids shouldn’t be taught to be sexist.
